tweets.text: We are still in attendance at a large fire in Avonmouth. The smoke from the incident is affecting a large area. Advice is to close all windows and doors and stay inside where possible. @PHE_uk @BristolCouncil @EnvAgencySW @bristolportpol @ASPolice #teamwork

@antony_hig @EnvAgencyNW @AndynBrown16 @DefraGovUK Interesting. I seem to remember this funding was secured by the Burnley Labour group and voted against by Burnley Tories. Which seems to fly in the face of your claim that Labour somehow let the people of Burnley down.

#floodalert #bradfordonavon - River levels peaked overnight & are now steadily falling. Thanks to CEVs Sarah & Ann M for final 09:00hrs report & @EnvAgencySW who are now packing up barriers. We have stood down river watch @BoATownCouncil @DWFRSBoA @WiltshireRoads @Trow_Fire_Stn https://t.co/awhMlJtfIb

1st storm of the season #StormAlex is here. EA & MetOffice are forecasting medium-high flood risk across the England & Wales, higher risk of flooding in Devon & Cornwall and coastal flooding likely in the SW & SE. Links & info below for farmers from @EnvAgency & @CLAtweets

We had discharging sewage from the @thameswater operated Chesham Sewage Treatment Works all weekend into the @RiverChess. With the river bursting its banks at number of places this helped spread the "joy" even further.

It's Monday, must be time for another @EnvAgency failure.

"Farmers on average receive a pollution inspection from the Environment Agency every 263 years.

https://t.co/VMQ2CkIp4M

@gojunick @EnvAgency Nearly there Nick. European Court of Justice has already ruled that this should only every happen in ‚ÄúExceptional circumstances‚Äù. Roughly this year that sewage overflow has being discharging on a monotonously regular basis and certain that you could call exceptional.

Latest @metoffice rainfall figures for Friday/Saturday/Sunday show Exmoor as the wettest place:

173.8mm at Blackpitts Gate
146mm at Wistlandpound

(October average for the whole SW is 146.5mm üò≥) @itvwestcountry

More good news at #Avonmouth. Yet another fire at @SimsMM those of secret meeting with cllrs and no prosecutions for multiple breaches of the law. No warnings to local residents #CoverdUpAgain @MarvinJRees @EnvAgency https://t.co/cZ7mDhg3fp

urls.title: Find out if you're at risk of flooding in England
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, check the 5-day forecast or use flood maps

tweets.text: 30cm of flowing water is enough to move your car. Never drive through flood water. What to do during a flood: https://t.co/yOnoPDvQSt https://t.co/YJEHqUeOdx
Please don't take unnecessary risks by trying to drive through floodwater, just 30cm of flowing water is enough to move your car. Stay #floodaware https://t.co/YP6WP6dzo9

Due to increased river levels in York the Foss Barrier has been lowered. It‚Äôs job is to stop the dominant river, the Ouse, backing up the Foss and increasing flood risk. Powerful pumps push the Foss water into a culvert so it can flow into the Ouse. https://t.co/PuVgYqJzH2

Due to forecasted heavy rain we have deployed Phase 1 of the #Northwich Scheme & erected temporary defences at Barons Quay. This has been done as a precautionary measure to protect the community from potential high river levels.

Check your #flood risk üëâhttps://t.co/DelUfH7Qeq https://t.co/F5TNr9XO7f
@SevernUnlocked @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup Wheres this

Lunt Meadows NR is closed closed until further notice. River Alt has overtopped at the spillway as per design but has breached at 2 further points undermining the bank. Visitors should not enter from any entrance & especially not walk on the river bank @EnvAgency  @LivEchonews https://t.co/JSybmCojnd
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @unitedutilities can you stop this happening in Lancashire please?
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/bNAXQbWW1G
Multiple fires at @SimsMM how many failures of the fire management plan will be tolerated before action is taken? @EnvAgency @MarvinJRees @AvonFireRescue @TristanCorkPost @bbcrb @InsideOutWest

tweets.text:
7.30am, Monday

We still have a sprinkling of flood alerts and some flood warnings across our region... 

...although conditions ARE, thankfully, improving...

You can get advice anytime on being prepared for flooding or dealing with it: https://t.co/aMPFhoaKkF 
#floodaware https://t.co/qgZe5MqmU7

Today‚Äôs horror show üí©üíÄüêüEA officers probably tucked up in bed üò¨Gaywood river dies üíÄdo your job & stop this destruction @TheLynnNews @Feargal_Sharkey @jamesowild @AngliaEnforceEA @WNGreens @N_Rivers_Trust @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd https://t.co/YGHboXZv2L https://t.co/Y6KJE9fMfz

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text:
Confirmation untreated sewage still being discharged from Chesham Sewage Treatment Works, going on since 8.30pm Friday 2nd Oct, expect this will continue today Sunday 4th Oct and probably into Monday. If you see discoloured water report to @EnvAgency 
 Hotline 0800807060

Field teams are on the ground again today checking structures and clearing trash screens etc. We are also proactively managing flows on the Parrett by using Monksleaze Clyse and the Sowy system. @EnvAgencySW @GaryBCutts https://t.co/9wkmpRSEs2
FLAG removed concrete blocks obscuring a surface water drain on Blenheim Ave. See the before and after pictures. @viaeastmidlands @NottsCC @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/FOBQmSOlji

A busy weekend for #TeamEA helping keep folk safe from #StormAlex - we start the week with 25 flood warnings still in force but an improving weather picture. As the storm season begins what better time to sign up to our free flood warnings here https://t.co/gfaL38C2kU https://t.co/FvYkPziLOk
